summary: The Explosive Substances Act, 2018, along with subsequent amendments, regulates the production, sale, transportation, and storage of explosive materials in Nepal. The Act defines explosive substances and outlines the process for modifying and repealing existing laws related to explosives. It also emphasizes the need for proper management and control of explosive materials to ensure public safety. The Act has been in effect since Jestha 15, 2065, and has undergone several amendments to strengthen the regulation of explosive substances in Nepal.

summary: The Explosive Substance Rules 2020 were published in the Nepal Gazette with amendments to the Explosive Substance Rules 2070 and 2080. The rules outline the procedures for obtaining permits for purchasing and selling explosive substances, as well as the authorization for their use. Individuals must obtain permits to purchase and use explosive substances for their own purposes, and those with permits can also distribute explosive substances to others for authorized purposes. The rules also specify the procedures for conducting research on explosive substances and the requirements for obtaining permits for transportation and sale.

summary: The text discusses the V.P. Koirala Memorial Hospital Act 2053, which focuses on cancer research and treatment. It mentions the establishment of the hospital and the formation of committees for cancer-related studies. The act aims to provide high-quality healthcare services for cancer patients and promote research in the field. It also highlights the need for establishing branches of the hospital in other districts as per the requirement. The act was first amended in 2064 to strengthen cancer research and treatment initiatives.

summary: The text discusses the establishment of the V.P. Koirala Institute of Health Sciences under the V.P. Koirala Health Science Institute Act, 2049. It outlines the objectives and duties of the institute in providing high-quality healthcare services and promoting health research in Nepal. The institute aims to make the general public self-reliant in healthcare and enhance the overall health sector. The text also mentions the legal framework and structure of the institute, emphasizing its role in advancing healthcare and medical education in the country.

Contrary to the Act, you are not required to be punished in accordance with the provisions of the Code of Criminal Procedure. District Agriculture Directorate

summary: The text discusses the Vision Regulation, 2069 published in the Nepal Gazette, which empowers the government to create regulations under the Vision Act, 2045. It outlines the formation and responsibilities of subcommittees, including the approval, release, and registration subcommittee, translation and evaluation subcommittee, and quality determination and management subcommittee. The subcommittees have the authority to organize their work according to the needs and may include members such as the Director General of Agriculture Department, Director of Soil Science Division, and Chief of Animal Science Department.
